main event: The document appears to be a page from a UFO report form from Project Blue Book, describing a UFO sighting that occurred on 27th October 1952 near the Dayton, Ohio area. The sighting involved a brilliant light, like a flare, passing swiftly across the sky from Northeast to Southwest, approximately the size of a star.
interesting points: The sighting lasted only a few seconds, during which a brilliant light resembling a flare passed swiftly from the Northeast to the Southwest across the sky.
The object appeared to be the size of a star and did not display any unusual behavior before or after the sighting.
The observer was actively looking towards the airport at the time of the sighting.
Routine power plant operations were being carried out in the 30 minutes leading up to the sighting.
The observer was not wearing glasses when the object was seen, and there is uncertainty about the weather conditions during the sighting.
photographs: The report does not indicate the inclusion of photographs
